result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A. Sornson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and follow through counseling.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, work search or combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process. 

Have no assaultive contact with T.C.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark A. Sornson

11:37 am - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, by zoom. Defendant Mark A. Sornson appeared by video.  Not guilty plea.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 10:50 am.

Re:  Victim, on 12-17-21.   
Initial appearance is set for 01-06-22 at 10:30 a.m.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of disorderly conduct (DVO) and battery (DVO).  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 01-06-22 at 10:30 a.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no abusive or assaultive contact with T.M.C., DOB: 03-27-1975, and no contact with K.G. and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
